p: It is important that Sub-Saharan African countries start to use local resources for the development of drugs. Therefore, this work intends to analyze the in vitro and in vivo studies of medicinal plants from Sub-Saharan Africa against Campylobacter spp. in order to identify effective extracts and chemical compounds against the bacteria that may be the subject of further studies for development of new drugs. To our knowledge, there is no systematized data for in vitro or in vivo activity of medicinal plants against this pathogen. Thus, this review is a pilot research that may direct future research to identify drug candidate molecules in Sub-Saharan African flora.
